snippet: Showing the big effects of a small event, researchers found that newborn lizards fed first in the lab were less likely to roam and harder to recapture and had smaller litters.
abstract: Study in journal Current Biology suggests that first meal a newborn lizard eats can change its life, influencing whether it leaves its birthplace and how many offspring it will have; researchers suspect that other animals, including humans, may be similarly influenced by small events.
lead_paragraph: Showing the big effects of a small event, researchers found that newborn lizards fed first in the lab were less likely to roam and harder to recapture and had smaller litters.

headline.main: For Some Lizards, First Meal Can Be Life-Altering
headline.print_headline: Animal Behavior: A Life-Altering First Meal
